dt: {bc}a movement in modern Protestantism emphasizing intellectual liberty and the spiritual and ethical content of Christianity

{bc}a theory in economics emphasizing individual freedom from restraint and usually based on free competition, the self-regulating market, and the gold standard {dx_def}see {dxt|gold standard||1}{/dx_def}

{bc}a political philosophy based on belief in progress, the essential goodness of the human race, and the autonomy {dx_def}see {dxt|autonomy||2}{/dx_def} of the individual and standing for the protection of political and civil liberties
{bc}such a philosophy that considers government as a crucial instrument for amelioration of social inequities (such as those involving race, gender, or class)
{bc}the principles and policies of a Liberal {dx_def}see {dxt|liberal:1||6b}{/dx_def} party

shortdef: the quality or state of being liberal
a movement in modern Protestantism emphasizing intellectual liberty and the spiritual and ethical content of Christianity
a theory in economics emphasizing individual freedom from restraint and usually based on free competition, the self-regulating market, and the gold standard

dt.t: Not all the comment on him was favourable, since he was seen as anti-Western, {wi}anti-liberal{/wi} and a Russian nationalist.

utxt.t: These romantic medievalists may moreover have strengthened Tolstoy's natural anti-intellectualism and {wi}anti-liberalism{/wi} …

shortdef: opposed to or hostile toward political liberalism
